BioStat | R package
  • Functions

Format p-values

Values below 0.001 are printed as "<0.001", between [0.001 and 0.01) as "<0.01", all others are rounded to two decimal places.

prettify_p_value(p)

prettify_p_column(data, colname = "p.value", prettify = TRUE,
  rm_zero = FALSE, ...)

add_signif_stars(p)

Arguments

p

A p-value (numeric or coercible to numeric).
data

A data frame.
colname

(string) A name of column with p-values.
prettify

(logical) should function prettify_p_value be applied.
...

(not used yet)
(logical)

If TRUE, leading zero of a number is removed.

Details

prettify_p_column formats a column of p-values in a data frame. prettify_p_column formats a single value.

Examples

library(BioStat)

# Make a dataframe with p-values
rez <- test_normality(uptake ~ Type,
                      data = CO2)
rez
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>          Type statistic      p.value
#> 1      Quebec 0.8598812 0.0001111111
#> 2 Mississippi 0.9363277 0.0213016282

# Shapiro-Wilk normality test
#
#          Type statistic      p.value
# 1      Quebec 0.8598812 0.0001111111
# 2 Mississippi 0.9363277 0.0213016282

# Do prettification:
prettify_p_column(rez)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>          Type statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec 0.8598812  <0.001
#> 2 Mississippi 0.9363277   0.02 

# Shapiro-Wilk normality test
#
#          Type statistic p.value
# 1      Quebec 0.8598812  <0.001
# 2 Mississippi 0.9363277   0.02

prettify_p_column(rez, rm_zero = TRUE)
#> 
#>  The results of Shapiro-Wilk normality test 
#> 
#>          Type statistic p.value
#> 1      Quebec 0.8598812   <.001
#> 2 Mississippi 0.9363277    .02 

# ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
# Prettify single p-values

prettify_p_value(0.005)
#> [1] "<0.01 "
prettify_p_value(0.0005)
#> [1] "<0.001"
prettify_p_value(0.052147)
#> [1] " 0.05 "
prettify_p_value("0.0022")
#> [1] "<0.01 "
prettify_p_value("0.052")
#> [1] " 0.05 "


add_signif_stars(0.005)
#> [1] "0.005 **"
add_signif_stars(0.0005)
#> [1] "5e-04 ***"
add_signif_stars(0.052147)
#> [1] "0.052147 ."
